result.execSummary:
The defendant Alexxa N Vassar was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Sentence is Stayed. Court grants 5 days credit if revoked.
Consecutive to: 22CM755

miscConds.notes: AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment recommended.  No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner they are prescribed.

Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent. No violent contact with Victims or Witnesses.

Attend Anger Management.  No Dangerous Weapons (e.g. Knives, firearms, etc)

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

Cash bail in the amount of $850 to be refunded to the poster.

Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all restitution/costs/fees, and no new law violations. If the Defendant violates any terms of his/her probation, or has any condition time imposed, the Court will deem that the conditions precedent necessary for the conditional grant of Expunction have not been met and therefore Expunction is denied. The defendant shall file a petition with the Court to verify the successful completion of the sentence.

COUNT 2

AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended

Follow through with any assessment, evaluation, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent
No Violent contact with: victims or witnesses
Anger Management
No Dangerous Weapons (e.g. Knives, firearms, etc.)

COSTS:  $243.00

DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $ 200.00
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.
*Cash Bail to be Refunded to the Poster*

Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all restitution/costs/fees, and no new law violations. If the Defendant violates any terms of his/her probation, or has any condition time imposed, the Court will deem that the conditions precedent necessary for the conditional grant of Expunction have not been met and therefore Expunction is denied. The defendant shall file a petition with the Court to verify the successful completion of the sentence.
